accept.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to take something that someone offers you, or to agree to do something that someone asks you to do
accept.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Rick accepted her offer of coffee.
He accepted the invitation to stay with us.
His school reports said that he is always ready to accept a challenge (=agree to do something difficult).
They offered me a job and I accepted.
He readily accepted her invitation  (=accepted it quickly).
He accepted a glass of water from Helen.
accept.translation[0].definitions[0].not: In everyday English, when talking about accepting a job, accepting responsibility or blame, or accepting a method of payment, people usually use take:
He decided to take her up on her offer.
When talking about accepting an offer, people often say take someone up on their offer:
He decided to take her up on her offer.
accept.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to decide that there is nothing you can do to change a difficult and unpleasant situation or fact and continue with your normal life
accept.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: He’s not going to change, and you just have to accept it.
He can't accept the fact that his problems are his own fault.
We have to accept that this is not an ideal world.
accept.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to decide that someone has the necessary skill or intelligence for a particular job, course etc or that a piece of work is good enough
accept.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: Students accepted by Stanford Law School had very high scores on the LSAT.
They have accepted him as the representative of the company.
Random House accepted the book for publication.
accept.translation[0].definitions[3].def: to allow someone to become part of a group, society, or organization, and to treat them in the same way as the other members
accept.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: The children gradually began to accept her as one of the family.
It often takes years for immigrants to be accepted into the host community.
accept.translation[0].definitions[4].def: to agree to take or deal with something that someone gives you, or to say that it is suitable or good enough
accept.translation[0].definitions[4].exa: The government has accepted the resignation of a senior army commander.
Sorry, we don’t accept traveller’s cheques.
accept.translation[0].definitions[5].def: to decide to do what someone suggests or advises you should do
accept.translation[0].definitions[5].exa: Be prepared to accept the advice of members of staff.
accept.translation[0].definitions[6].def: to agree that what someone says is right or true
accept.translation[0].definitions[6].exa: She has accepted your explanation as to why you didn’t attend the meeting.
accept.translation[0].definitions[6].not: In more formal English, you say it is accepted that when saying what people generally believe is true
It is accepted that he was sincere in his claim
accept.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: In the end I had to accept his offer of £4,500.
Are you going to accept their invitation to the wedding?
Don’t be afraid to accept help if you need it.
Egypt gratefully accepted American economic aid.
They were ready to accept French military assistance.
To protect the environment we must accept some difficult challenges.
Miller accepted the award for best comedy show.
I wish that I’d accepted the opportunity to retire when it was offered.
Accepting presents from him made her feel uncomfortable.
She was desperate for money so she accepted the job.
I had been taught not to accept lifts from strangers.
The president’s family and friends accepted massive bribes in exchange for official favours.
She invited him for a drink and he gladly accepted.

accept.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to take or agree to take something that has been offered
accept.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: The steel workers have accepted a 3% wage offer.
Doctors should not accept expensive gifts from pharmaceutical companies.
accept.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to agree to a plan, idea, agreement etc
accept.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: The US is ready to accept the deal.
accept.translation[1].definitions[2].def: to agree to take goods that have been ordered
accept.translation[1].definitions[2].exa: The company has shipped three supercomputers, but only two have been accepted.
accept.translation[1].definitions[3].def: when people accept a new product, they like it and are willing to buy it
accept.translation[1].definitions[3].exa: The machine is too highly priced to be accepted by the mass of US consumers.
accept.translation[1].definitions[4].def: to allow customers to pay using these forms of payment
accept.translation[1].definitions[5].def: to agree to pay a BILL OF EXCHANGE
accept.translation[1].definitions[6].def: to officially agree to insure something
accept.translation[1].definitions[6].exa: The insurance company reserves the right to make medical checks prior to accepting a risk on health insurance.
